meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the violin.
meanings.sent1: Her violinistic skills were evident in the beautiful music she played.
meanings.sent2: The violinistic sound of the orchestra filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent3: He tried to cook dinner with a violinistic flair, but it just ended up sounding like a mess.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted with such violinistic precision that every stroke seemed to sing.
meanings.sent5: The violinistic decorations in the room gave it a touch of elegance.

meanings.definition: In the style or manner of playing the violin.
meanings.sent1: She moved violinistically across the stage, captivating the audience with her performance.
meanings.sent2: The musician played the piano violinistically, drawing out each note with grace.
meanings.sent3: He danced violinistically to the beat, causing everyone to smile at his unique style.
meanings.sent4: The wind blew violinistically through the trees, creating a melodic rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: The chef chopped vegetables violinistically, with swift and precise movements.
